alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 30 at 1:02PM MST until July 30 at 4:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Pipeline Fire East in... Coconino County in north central Arizona... * Until 400 PM MST. * At 100 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Pipeline Fire East. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen over the Pipeline Fire scar. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will result in debris flow moving through the Government Tank drainage. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Pipeline Fire East. SOURCE...Gauges reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Pipeline Fire East. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Doney Park. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Immediately move out of and away from creeks and washes in the Pipeline Fire East. Flash flooding is occurring or imminent. Turn Around, Don`t Drown if you encounter flood waters while driving.
